direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods deal with text content of elements, but 'text()' retrieves the combined text while 'hasText()' checks for the presence of non-blank text.
Both methods process text content of elements, but 'eachText()' collects the text of each element into a list while 'hasText()' checks for the presence of text.
Both methods iterate over elements and check for a specific condition ('hasClass' checks for a class, 'hasText' checks for text content), sharing similar control flow and iteration logic.
Both methods iterate over elements and check for a specific condition ('hasAttr' checks for an attribute, 'hasText' checks for text content), sharing similar control flow and iteration logic.
Both methods evaluate elements against a condition ('is' checks if an element matches a query, 'hasText' checks if an element has text), sharing similar evaluation logic.
